Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Default the Person making the comment to the processing person if not submitted via the web service.

Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: Captures the Comment for the Business Process.

description: Business Process Parameters provide the ability to auto-submit to the business process.

Catalog_Load_Item__HV__Data.description: Used to inactivate an existing Catalog Item via the Catalog Load WWS request.  Please note that if this field is set, any updates to the Catalog Item included in the WWS request will not be carried over when the Catalog Load request is approved.

validation.validation: Can't enter duplicate Item Identifier Type if the Allow Multiples flag is false.

Catalog_Load_Item_Unit_of_Measure_Data.description: Unit of Measure Reference for the Catalog Load Item.
UN CEFACT Common Code for Catalog Load Item.
Conversion Factor between the Ordering Unit of Measure and the Base Unit of Measure of Catalog Load Item.
Indicates whether this Unit of Measure is the default UOM.
Indicates whether the Unit Of Measure is applicable for Just In Time.
Lead time for the UOM of the Catalog Item.
The minimum quantity per unit of measure for Item. A value of zero means that there is no minimum order quantity.

validation.validation: You cannot set Minimum Order Quantity for Just in Time items.

Catalog_Load_Item_Unit_of_Measure_Data.description: Indicates whether the Unit of Measure is inactive.

validation.validation: A default Unit of Measure cannot be marked inactive.

Catalog_Load_Item__HV__Data.description: Catalog Load Item Unit of Measure

validation.validation: Provide a valid UN CEFACT UOM Code.

Catalog_Load__HV__Data.description: Element containing Catalog Load Item data.

validation.validation: Cannot use Catalog Item ID as it is used for a different Catalog Item
Provide a valid Spend Category when you specify the Purchase Item for the Catalog Item.
Item Tag is Inactive.
No more than four additional images can be assigned to an item.
You can't specify duplicate Item Identifiers on Catalog Load.
You can't specify Item Tags for internal service catalog loads.
You can't specify duplicate ordering units of measure.
Select a default ordering unit of measure for the catalog load item.
You can't specify a Purchase Item reference for internal service catalog loads.
You can't mark units of measure as inactive when loading new catalog items.
You can't specify alternate item identifiers for internal service catalog loads.
Enter the same base Unit of Measure of the purchase item when there is a purchase item reference.
Only one unit of measure can be selected as the default.
Select a default Just In Time ordering unit of measure for the catalog load item.
You can't enter duplicate Just In Time units of measure.
Only one Just In Time unit of measure can be selected as the default.
You can’t set catalog items as Inactive when they haven’t been loaded into the catalog.
Select an active spend category with procurement usage. [Spend Category or UNSPSC code] is not a valid entry.
You can't select a UNSPSC or NIGP type alternate item identifier when you select a commodity code. Either remove the commodity code or the alternate item identifier.
You can't specify a Commodity Code reference for internal service catalog loads.
Submit a valid commodity code or leave the commodity code field blank. [Commodity Codes] is/are invalid.
You can select only 1 code for each commodity code type.
Specify a Purchase Item that has the same Spend Category as the Catalog Item.
There is already an update in progress for the related purchase item.
